title: Hassan's 23 heart attack deaths in 40 days: Is the Covid vaccine behind the sudden deaths in Karnataka? - The Economic Times
text: In Hassan, worry has gripped families after 23 people died from heart attacks in only 40 days. Many victims were young or middle-aged. Some were students, others were workers like the 27-year-old woodworker who died last Tuesday. The data paints a bleak pictureâ€”between 28 May and 29 June, the deaths covered all age groups, from teenagers to senior citizens.Jayadeva Hospital in Bengaluru has seen an 8% jump in heart patients in two weeks. Most arrive from Hassan and nearby areas. District Health data shows 507 heart attacks were recorded in Hassan in two years. Of these, 190 people could not be saved.CM points finger at Covid vaccineThe sharp rise has pushed the Karnataka government into action. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has formed a special committee. Dr Ravindranath, Director of Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Sciences and Research, will lead it. The panel must submit its findings in ten days.But Siddaramaiah stirred debate by pointing at Covid jabs. On X, he wrote, â€œOrders were given to this same committee back in February to conduct a thorough study on the reasons behind sudden deaths among young people in the state, and whether the Covid vaccines could have any adverse effects.â€He added, â€œIt cannot be denied that the hasty approval and distribution of the Covid vaccine to the public could also be a reason for these deaths, as several studies worldwide have recently indicated that Covid vaccines could be a cause for the increasing number of heart attacks.â€Health Minister asks public not to panicHealth Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao urged people to stay calm while the probe continues. He told News18, â€œOnce we get the report, we will be able to speak with greater clarity. These are matters that must be properly investigated. Speculation at this stage could cause unnecessary alarm.â€Centre stands firm on vaccine safetyThe Union Health Ministry stepped in quickly. It said on Tuesday there is no evidence to back claims that Covid vaccines cause sudden deaths. It pointed to studies by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC). In its statement, the ministry said, â€œThe matter of sudden unexplained deaths has been investigated through several agencies in the country. These studies have conclusively established that there is no direct link between Covid 19 vaccination and the reports of sudden deaths in the country.â€Two major studies say no linkICMR ran a nationwide study from May to August 2023. It checked cases in 47 hospitals across 19 states and union territories. Researchers tracked sudden deaths of healthy-looking young adults from October 2021 to March 2023. They found no rise due to vaccines.AIIMS, New Delhi, with ICMRâ€™s support, is conducting another study. Early results show the leading cause remains heart attacks and other health conditions, not vaccines. The ministry stressed, â€œStudies by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) affirm that Covid-19 vaccines in India are safe and effective, with extremely rare instances of serious side effects. Sudden cardiac deaths can result from a wide range of factors, including genetics, lifestyle, pre-existing conditions, and post-Covid complications.â€Experts warn against vaccine fearThe Health Ministry warned, â€œSpreading such claims without proper evidence is harmful. Vaccines saved millions of lives during the pandemic. Such false claims can damage trust in vaccines.â€Medical experts too say panic over vaccines could stop people from getting important shots.Doctors say lifestyle plays a big role. Many young professionals work long hours with little rest. The issue is bigger than Hassan. For example, Infosys recently warned staff against working more than 9 hours and 15 minutes a day for five days a week. The IT giantâ€™s note counters co-founder Narayana Murthyâ€™s controversial pitch for a 70-hour work week. The company wants staff to avoid burnout, as long hours can silently raise heart risks.Back in Hassan, families wait for clarity. The expert panel will file its report within days. Until then, doctors ask people to watch for chest pain, breathlessness, or sudden fatigue. Siddaramaiah posted, â€œWe have formed a committee led by Dr Ravindranath, Director of Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Sciences and Research. They have been asked to study the situation and give a report within 10 days.â€Hassan watches. So does the rest of Karnataka.

author: Ollie Williams
title: Unions hold Yellowknife rally as postal strike enters third week
text:
Members of multiple unions staged a solidarity rally outside Yellowknifeâ€™s downtown post office on Friday as a postal strike crossed into a third week of action. On the picket line outside the post office, members of the Canadian Union of Postal Workers said time was almost up for any hope of moving northernersâ€™ mail before Christmas.
â€œI almost think itâ€™s already too late but, worst-case scenario, come Monday morning, we should be back to work if weâ€™re going to save anything at all for the Christmas period,â€ said Loretta Kaminski, who works at the Yellowknife post office.
â€œIn my mind, even just for Yellowknife to the south? Monday.â€
Kaminski said she had little optimism that anyone would be returning to work that day.
Talks between Canada Post and the union collapsed this week , with each side criticizing the other in a series of statements. Officials said there was no point in negotiations continuing for the time being as the sides remained so far apart.
â€œI hope they can get back to the table and just figure it out,â€ said Danielle Hawes, who works at the mail processing plant near Yellowknifeâ€™s airport. â€œHopefully they can reach some sort of agreement that both sides can agree on and makes everybody happy.â€
Hawes thanked the public for their support on the picket line in this weekâ€™s frigid temperatures. Members of the Union of Northern Workers, Public Service Alliance of Canada and Northern Territories Federation of Labour joined CUPW members for Fridayâ€™s rally.
For Kaminski and colleague Julie Thibault, this is the third time they have each experienced a postal strike.
â€œWe all ought to be at work right now. Thereâ€™s a lot of northern communities getting access to nothing because we are their main hub,â€ said Thibault.
â€œOther than that, weâ€™ll just keep trying to wait it out and hope for the best.â€
Kaminski said she is due to retire in five monthsâ€™ time after a quarter of a century with the organization.
â€œThis is not the way I wanted to go out,â€ she said, accusing Canada Post of â€œplaying more hardball now than they ever did beforeâ€ in previous labour disputes.
Canada Post began issuing records of employment and temporarily laying off workers this week, which Kaminski said was a tactic not seen before, questioning its legality. (â€œDue to CUPWâ€™s ongoing national labour disruption and the significant impact on the company, we have made adjustments to our operations,â€ a spokesperson for the company said earlier, confirming the layoffs.)
On Wednesday, the CUPW said on its website: â€œCanada Post refuses to drop its proposed rollbacks that will create a second class of worker and undermine good, full-time jobs. As a Crown corporation, Canada Post needs to lead by example, not engage in a race to the bottom with multinational corporate giants.â€
In an emailed statement on Thursday, Canada Post wrote in part: â€œWe understand the impact CUPWâ€™s national strike is having on so many Canadians. We remain committed to negotiating new agreements that let all employees focus on the future, without adding new fixed costs that will hamper our future.â€

Corey Sadler Jr. named 2024 MaxPreps Michigan High School Football Player of the Year
Cass Tech standout dominated in all three phases for Division 1 state champions.
By
Zack Poff
Follow Zack Poff on Twitter
Dec 5, 2024, 11:00am
HIGHLIGHTS: 4-star ATH CJ Sadler helps Cass Tech win first state title since 2016
38,521 views
2:31
Each year since 2006, MaxPreps has recognized outstanding performers in high school football. America's source for high school sports continues the tradition to close out the 2024 season by naming the top player in each state. Selections are based on team success and individual excellence in addition to local and state accolades.
Corey Sadler Jr
. of
Cass Tech (Detroit)
is the 2024 MaxPreps Michigan High School Football Player of the Year. The 5-foot-11, 190-pound junior helped the Technicians to a 12-2 record and Division 1 state title, the school's first since 2016.
Sadler lined up everywhere offensively but shined at wide receiver, where he hauled in 51 receptions for 1,043 yards and 14 touchdowns. He completed all 11 passes he attempted for 180 yards and four scores to go with 15 carries for 105 yards and five touchdowns.
Defensively, Sadler had 55 tackles, four interceptions and one sack. He was also dynamic on special teams with two kickoff return touchdowns and one punt return for a score.
Corey Sadler Jr. did it all for Cass Tech, helping the Technicians win 10 in a row en route to the Division 1 state championship. (File photo: Scott Hasse)
In a 42-20 win over Hudsonville in the Division 1 state championship game, Sadler caught six balls for 47 yards and two touchdowns. He added three tackles on defense.
After a 2-2 start, the Technicians reeled off 10 straight wins to close out the season. Sadler was one of the leaders on offense, defense and special teams. During the win streak Cass Tech outscored its opponents 369-75.
Sadler is the top-rated player in Michigan from the Class of 2026 according to
247Sports
and a top 100 prospect nationally. He has landed over 30 FBS offers including Alabama, Michigan, Miami, Ohio State, Oregon, Penn State and Tennessee.
Each state's MaxPreps Player of the Year will be considered for inclusion in the MaxPreps All-America Team.
Past MaxPreps Michigan Players of the Year
2020 â€” Donovan Edwards, RB, West Bloomfield
2021 â€” Dante Moore, QB, King (Detroit)
2022 â€” Bryce Underwood, QB, Belleville
2023 â€” Isaiah Marshall, QB, Southfield A&T (Southfield)

author: James Howell Jr.
title: INDOT announces plans to reopen I-465 southbound
text: INDIANAPOLIS â€” I-465 southbound on the city's southeast side will soon reopen. On Friday, INDOT announced their plans to roll out the reopening of the interstate after a three week closure. The closure of I-465 southbound between I-70 and I-65 on the southeast side started on May 31 as crews worked on pavement restoration and bridge work. Now, three weeks later, the road is ready for traffic again. ðŸ“ Marion Countyâ€” INDOT East Central (@INDOTEast) Here's what to expect for the reopening of the I-465 southbound lanes and ramps. ðŸ‘‡ We start with restriping all of the lanes to get them back to their original configuration. This is a long process - expect the lanes to steadily reopen. [pic.twitter.com/7cdXGy7Lnf] [June 21, 2024] Lanes and ramps will open between late Friday and Saturday morning. Meanwhile, lane restriping will be done slightly north of the reopening â€” between 46th Street and I-70. Don't breathe too easy though Hoosiers. WATCH | Indiana's Latest Headlines After a three week break, INDOT will close I-465 northbound through the same stretch. That closure is expected to start on July 12.

author: Jason Kottke
title: The Rollercoaster of Compassionate Death
text:
The Rollercoaster of Compassionate Death
The Euthanasia Coaster is designed to thrill the hell out of its passengers just before it kills them.
Each inversion would have a smaller diameter than the one before in order to inflict 10 g to passengers while the train loses speed. After a sharp right-hand turn the train would enter a straight, where unloading of bodies and loading of passengers could take place.
The Euthanasia Coaster would kill its passengers through prolonged cerebral hypoxia, or insufficient supply of oxygen to the brain. The rideâ€™s seven inversions would inflict 10 g on its passengers for 60 seconds â€” causing g-force related symptoms starting with gray out through tunnel vision to black out and eventually g-LOC, g-force induced loss of consciousness. Depending on the tolerance of an individual passenger to g-forces, the first or second inversion would cause cerebral anoxia, rendering the passengers brain dead. Subsequent inversions would serve as insurance against unintentional survival of passengers.

Una de estas herramientas es el 'vision board', tambiÃ©n conocido como el mapa de los deseos o mapa de sueÃ±os, que permite visualizar lo que se desea alcanzar en la vida y mantenerse motivado para lograrlo. Â¿QuÃ© es un 'vision board', para quÃ© sirve y cÃ³mo se utiliza? El 'vision board' puede tomar formas diversas, desde un tablero de corcho con imÃ¡genes y recortes de revistas hasta un collage digital creado con software de diseÃ±o grÃ¡fico. No existen reglas rigurosas para hacerlo , lo importante es que sea algo que inspire y motive a cada persona.
No dejes de leer
Â¿Por quÃ© se escuchan Pastor LÃ³pez y Los MelÃ³dicos en la Navidad colombiana? Â¿Buscando pareja? Descubre rituales de AÃ±o Nuevo para atraer el amor en 2024 El 'vision board' es "un recordatorio constante de los aspectos en los que debemos trabajar diariamente para hacer realidad nuestras metas". Â¿CuÃ¡l es la funciÃ³n del 'vision board'? Esta herramienta funciona como una f orma visual de representar los objetivos y sueÃ±os. Al verlos materializados de esta manera, se vuelven mÃ¡s tangibles y reales, lo cual contribuye a mantenernos motivados y enfocados en alcanzarlos.
El 'vision board' ayuda a crear un sentido de propÃ³sito, permitiÃ©ndonos descubrir quÃ© es importante para nosotros y quÃ© queremos lograr en nuestra vida.
AdemÃ¡s, rodearnos de imÃ¡genes y palabras positivas puede generar una vibraciÃ³n positiva en nuestra vida, reforzando nuestro compromiso con nuestros objetivos.
Â¿CÃ³mo crear un 'vision board'? 1. Visualiza tus metas : tÃ³mate un tiempo para reflexionar sobre tus objetivos y sueÃ±os. Â¿QuÃ© te gustarÃ­a lograr en tu vida? Â¿QuÃ© te gustarÃ­a hacer, ser o sentir en el prÃ³ximo aÃ±o? Haz una lista de tus metas.
2. Busca imÃ¡genes y elementos que representen tus metas : una vez que tengas tus metas definidas, busca imÃ¡genes, frases o elementos que las representen. Puedes encontrar estas representaciones en revistas, libros, Internet o incluso puedes crear tus propias imÃ¡genes.
3. Crea tu ' vision board': una vez que tengas tus imÃ¡genes y palabras , es hora de crear tu mapa de sueÃ±os. Puedes utilizar un tablero de corcho, un lienzo o incluso un programa de diseÃ±o grÃ¡fico, segÃºn tu preferencia.
4. Coloca tu 'vision board' en un lugar visible : una vez que hayas terminado de crear tu 'vision board', colÃ³calo en un lugar donde puedas verlo todos los dÃ­as. Esto te ayudarÃ¡ a mantener el enfoque en la consecuciÃ³n de tus metas.
El 'vision board' puede ser un poderoso ritual que te ayudarÃ¡ a comenzar el 2024 con trabajo y compromiso para alcanzar lo que deseas. Lo primero sÃ© realista, es importante establecer metas alcanzables. Si te pones metas demasiado ambiciosas, es mÃ¡s probable que te frustres y pierdas la motivaciÃ³n.
 Actualiza regularmente tu 'vision board': a medida que tus metas vayan cambiando, actualiza tu 'vision board' para reflejar estos cambios. Esto te ayudarÃ¡ a mantenerte motivado y enfocado en tu progreso. Utilizar el 'vision board' como un lienzo en blanco , no solo recortar y pegar, sino ser creativo y darle un sentido personal. Es importante asegurarse de que las representaciones elegidas sean realmente lo que uno piensa y siente acerca de lo que quiere en la vida.
En definitiva, el 'vi sion board' puede convertirse en una valiosa herramienta para manifestar nuestros sueÃ±os y metas en el aÃ±o 2024. AsÃ­ que Â¡no esperes mÃ¡s y comienza a visualizar tu Ã©xito y felicidad!

author: redacao@odia.com.br (O Dia)

author: Redazione Donne Magazine
title: Addio a Marianne Faithfull, icona del rock e della cultura pop
text:
Una vita intensa e controversa Marianne Faithfull, scomparsa a 78 anni, ha lasciato un segno indelebile nella storia della musica e della cultura pop. Nata a Hampstead, Londra, in una famiglia benestante, la sua vita Ã¨ stata caratterizzata da alti e bassi, successi e sfide personali. La sua voce unica e il suo stile inconfondibile lâ€™hanno resa unâ€™icona della Swinging London, un periodo di grande fermento culturale e musicale.
Il debutto nel mondo della musica La carriera di Marianne Ã¨ decollata quando, a soli 17 anni, fu notata da Andrew Loog Oldham, il manager dei Rolling Stones. Fu lui a suggerire a Mick Jagger e Keith Richards di scrivere â€œAs Tears Go Byâ€, il suo primo grande successo. Questa canzone, con il suo testo malinconico e profondo, ha catturato lâ€™attenzione del pubblico, segnando lâ€™inizio di una carriera straordinaria. La sua presenza scenica e la sua voce graffiante hanno fatto di lei una figura centrale nella musica degli anni â€™60.
Amori e relazioni La vita personale di Marianne Ã¨ stata altrettanto intensa. Dopo un matrimonio breve con John Dunbar, la sua relazione con Mick Jagger ha attirato lâ€™attenzione dei media e del pubblico. Questa storia dâ€™amore, segnata da passione e tumulto, ha influenzato non solo la sua vita, ma anche la musica dellâ€™epoca. Marianne ha vissuto in prima persona le sfide della fama, affrontando anche momenti difficili legati a dipendenze e crisi personali. Tuttavia, la sua resilienza e il suo talento lâ€™hanno sempre riportata sulla scena.
Unâ€™ereditÃ  duratura Marianne Faithfull non Ã¨ stata solo una cantante, ma anche unâ€™attrice e una poetessa. La sua carriera si Ã¨ evoluta nel tempo, abbracciando diversi generi musicali e collaborando con artisti di fama mondiale. La sua capacitÃ  di reinventarsi e di rimanere rilevante nel panorama musicale Ã¨ un testamento della sua grandezza. Anche dopo la sua scomparsa, la sua musica continua a ispirare nuove generazioni di artisti e fan.
